com.agsw.FabricView.DrawableObjects

Class CPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.agsw.FabricView.DrawableObjects.CDrawable
      • com.agsw.FabricView.DrawableObjects.CPath

  • public class CPath
extends CDrawable
    Created by antwan on 10/3/2015. This is a series of continuous lines. Note that the superclass' x, y, width, and height are irrelevant here so they are ignored.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Description copied from class: CDrawable
        This function is used to draw the current object on the canvas. Subclasses must implement it.
        Specified by:
        draw in class CDrawable
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas to draw on.

      • lineTo

        public void lineTo(float x,
                   float y)
        Draws a line from the last line ending to the specified position.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position of the end of the line.
        y - The vertical position of the end of the line.

      • quadTo

        public void quadTo(float x1,
                   float y1,
                   float x2,
                   float y2)
        Draws a quadratic bezier line from the last line ending to the specified position.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve
        y1 - The y-coordinate of the control point on a quadratic curve
        x2 - The x-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve
        y2 - The y-coordinate of the end point on a quadratic curve

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(float x,
                   float y)
        When drawing a line, use this method first to specify the start position.
        Parameters:
        x - The start position horizontally.
        y - The start position vertically.
